speaker: BOULT
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: BOULT
text_entry: Enter GOWER

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: pavilion on deck, with a curtain before it; PERICLES

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: within it, reclined on a couch. A barge lying

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: beside the Tyrian vessel.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Enter two Sailors, one belonging to the Tyrian vessel, the other to the barge; to them HELICANUS

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: [To the Sailor of Mytilene]  Where is lord Helicanus?

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: he can resolve you.

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: O, here he is.

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: Sir, there's a barge put off from Mytilene,

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: And in it is Lysimachus the governor,

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: Who craves to come aboard. What is your will?

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: That he have his. Call up some gentlemen.

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: Ho, gentlemen! my lord calls.

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: Enter two or three Gentlemen

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Doth your lordship call?

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Gentlemen, there's some of worth would come aboard;

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: I pray ye, greet them fairly.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: The Gentlemen and the two Sailors descend, and go on board the barge

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Enter, from thence, LYSIMACHUS and Lords; with the Gentlemen and the two Sailors

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: This is the man that can, in aught you would,

speaker: Tyrian Sailor
text_entry: Resolve you.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Hail, reverend sir! the gods preserve you!

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: And you, sir, to outlive the age I am,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: And die as I would do.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: You wish me well.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Being on shore, honouring of Neptune's triumphs,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Seeing this goodly vessel ride before us,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: I made to it, to know of whence you are.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: First, what is your place?

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: I am the governor of this place you lie before.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Our vessel is of Tyre, in it the king;

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: A man who for this three months hath not spoken

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: To any one, nor taken sustenance

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: But to prorogue his grief.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Upon what ground is his distemperature?

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: 'Twould be too tedious to repeat;

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: But the main grief springs from the loss

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Of a beloved daughter and a wife.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: May we not see him?

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: You may;

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: But bootless is your sight: he will not speak To any.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Yet let me obtain my wish.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Behold him.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: PERICLES discovered

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: This was a goodly person,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Till the disaster that, one mortal night,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Drove him to this.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Sir king, all hail! the gods preserve you!

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Hail, royal sir!

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: It is in vain; he will not speak to you.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: We have a maid in Mytilene, I durst wager,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Would win some words of him.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: 'Tis well bethought.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: She questionless with her sweet harmony

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: And other chosen attractions, would allure,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: And make a battery through his deafen'd parts,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Which now are midway stopp'd:

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: She is all happy as the fairest of all,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: And, with her fellow maids is now upon

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: The leafy shelter that abuts against

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: The island's side.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Whispers a Lord, who goes off in the barge of LYSIMACHUS

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Sure, all's effectless; yet nothing we'll omit

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: That bears recovery's name. But, since your kindness

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: We have stretch'd thus far, let us beseech you

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: That for our gold we may provision have,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Wherein we are not destitute for want,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: But weary for the staleness.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: O, sir, a courtesy

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Which if we should deny, the most just gods

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: For every graff would send a caterpillar,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: And so afflict our province. Yet once more

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Let me entreat to know at large the cause

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Of your king's sorrow.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Sit, sir, I will recount it to you:

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: But, see, I am prevented.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Re-enter, from the barge, Lord, with MARINA, and a young Lady

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: O, here is

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: The lady that I sent for. Welcome, fair one!

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Is't not a goodly presence?

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: She's a gallant lady.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: She's such a one, that, were I well assured

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Came of a gentle kind and noble stock,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: I'ld wish no better choice, and think me rarely wed.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Fair one, all goodness that consists in bounty

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Expect even here, where is a kingly patient:

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: If that thy prosperous and artificial feat

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Can draw him but to answer thee in aught,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Thy sacred physic shall receive such pay

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: As thy desires can wish.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Sir, I will use

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My utmost skill in his recovery, Provided

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: That none but I and my companion maid

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Be suffer'd to come near him.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Come, let us leave her;

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: And the gods make her prosperous!

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: MARINA sings

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Mark'd he your music?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: No, nor look'd on us.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: See, she will speak to him.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Hail, sir! my lord, lend ear.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Hum, ha!

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I am a maid,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My lord, that ne'er before invited eyes,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: But have been gazed on like a comet: she speaks,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My lord, that, may be, hath endured a grief

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Might equal yours, if both were justly weigh'd.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Though wayward fortune did malign my state,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My derivation was from ancestors

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Who stood equivalent with mighty kings:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: But time hath rooted out my parentage,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: And to the world and awkward casualties

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Bound me in servitude.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Aside

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I will desist;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: But there is something glows upon my cheek,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: And whispers in mine ear, 'Go not till he speak.'

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My fortunes--parentage--good parentage--

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To equal mine!--was it not thus? what say you?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I said, my lord, if you did know my parentage,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: You would not do me violence.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I do think so. Pray you, turn your eyes upon me.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: You are like something that--What country-woman?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Here of these shores?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: No, nor of any shores:

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Yet I was mortally brought forth, and am

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: No other than I appear.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I am great with woe, and shall deliver weeping.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My dearest wife was like this maid, and such a one

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My daughter might have been: my queen's square brows;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Her stature to an inch; as wand-like straight;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As silver-voiced; her eyes as jewel-like

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And cased as richly; in pace another Juno;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Who starves the ears she feeds, and makes them hungry,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The more she gives them speech. Where do you live?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Where I am but a stranger: from the deck

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: You may discern the place.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Where were you bred?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And how achieved you these endowments, which

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: You make more rich to owe?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: If I should tell my history, it would seem

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Like lies disdain'd in the reporting.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Prithee, speak:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Falseness cannot come from thee; for thou look'st

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Modest as Justice, and thou seem'st a palace

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For the crown'd Truth to dwell in: I will

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: believe thee,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And make my senses credit thy relation

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To points that seem impossible; for thou look'st

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Like one I loved indeed. What were thy friends?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Didst thou not say, when I did push thee back--

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Which was when I perceived thee--that thou camest

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: From good descending?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: So indeed I did.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Report thy parentage. I think thou said'st

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou hadst been toss'd from wrong to injury,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And that thou thought'st thy griefs might equal mine,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: If both were open'd.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Some such thing

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I said, and said no more but what my thoughts

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Did warrant me was likely.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Tell thy story;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: If thine consider'd prove the thousandth part

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Of my endurance, thou art a man, and I

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Have suffer'd like a girl: yet thou dost look

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Like Patience gazing on kings' graves, and smiling

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Extremity out of act. What were thy friends?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How lost thou them? Thy name, my most kind virgin?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Recount, I do beseech thee: come, sit by me.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My name is Marina.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O, I am mock'd,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And thou by some incensed god sent hither

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To make the world to laugh at me.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Patience, good sir,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Or here I'll cease.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Nay, I'll be patient.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou little know'st how thou dost startle me,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To call thyself Marina.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: The name

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Was given me by one that had some power,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My father, and a king.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How! a king's daughter?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And call'd Marina?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: You said you would believe me;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: But, not to be a troubler of your peace,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I will end here.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: But are you flesh and blood?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Have you a working pulse? and are no fairy?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Motion! Well; speak on. Where were you born?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And wherefore call'd Marina?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Call'd Marina

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: For I was born at sea.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: At sea! what mother?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My mother was the daughter of a king;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Who died the minute I was born,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: As my good nurse Lychorida hath oft

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Deliver'd weeping.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O, stop there a little!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Aside

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: This is the rarest dream that e'er dull sleep

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Did mock sad fools withal: this cannot be:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My daughter's buried. Well: where were you bred?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I'll hear you more, to the bottom of your story,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And never interrupt you.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: You scorn: believe me, 'twere best I did give o'er.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I will believe you by the syllable

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Of what you shall deliver. Yet, give me leave:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How came you in these parts? where were you bred?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: The king my father did in Tarsus leave me;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Till cruel Cleon, with his wicked wife,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Did seek to murder me: and having woo'd

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: A villain to attempt it, who having drawn to do't,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: A crew of pirates came and rescued me;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Brought me to Mytilene. But, good sir,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Whither will you have me? Why do you weep?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: It may be,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: You think me an impostor: no, good faith;

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: I am the daughter to King Pericles,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: If good King Pericles be.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Ho, Helicanus!

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Calls my lord?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou art a grave and noble counsellor,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Most wise in general: tell me, if thou canst,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: What this maid is, or what is like to be,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That thus hath made me weep?

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: I know not; but

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Here is the regent, sir, of Mytilene

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Speaks nobly of her.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: She would never tell

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Her parentage; being demanded that,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: She would sit still and weep.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O Helicanus, strike me, honour'd sir;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Give me a gash, put me to present pain;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Lest this great sea of joys rushing upon me

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O'erbear the shores of my mortality,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And drown me with their sweetness. O, come hither,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou that beget'st him that did thee beget;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou that wast born at sea, buried at Tarsus,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And found at sea again! O Helicanus,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Down on thy knees, thank the holy gods as loud

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As thunder threatens us: this is Marina.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: What was thy mother's name? tell me but that,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For truth can never be confirm'd enough,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Though doubts did ever sleep.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: First, sir, I pray,

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: What is your title?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I am Pericles of Tyre: but tell me now

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My drown'd queen's name, as in the rest you said

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou hast been godlike perfect,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The heir of kingdoms and another like

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To Pericles thy father.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Is it no more to be your daughter than

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: To say my mother's name was Thaisa?

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Thaisa was my mother, who did end

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: The minute I began.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Now, blessing on thee! rise; thou art my child.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Give me fresh garments. Mine own, Helicanus;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: She is not dead at Tarsus, as she should have been,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: By savage Cleon: she shall tell thee all;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: When thou shalt kneel, and justify in knowledge

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: She is thy very princess. Who is this?

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Sir, 'tis the governor of Mytilene,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Who, hearing of your melancholy state,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Did come to see you.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I embrace you.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Give me my robes. I am wild in my beholding.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O heavens bless my girl! But, hark, what music?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Tell Helicanus, my Marina, tell him

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O'er, point by point, for yet he seems to doubt,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How sure you are my daughter. But, what music?

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: My lord, I hear none.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: None!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The music of the spheres! List, my Marina.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: It is not good to cross him; give him way.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Rarest sounds! Do ye not hear?

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: My lord, I hear.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Music

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Most heavenly music!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: It nips me unto listening, and thick slumber

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Hangs upon mine eyes: let me rest.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Sleeps

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: A pillow for his head:

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: So, leave him all. Well, my companion friends,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: If this but answer to my just belief,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: I'll well remember you.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Exeunt all but PERICLES

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: DIANA appears to PERICLES as in a vision

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: My temple stands in Ephesus: hie thee thither,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: And do upon mine altar sacrifice.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: There, when my maiden priests are met together,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Before the people all,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Reveal how thou at sea didst lose thy wife:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: To mourn thy crosses, with thy daughter's, call

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: And give them repetition to the life.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Or perform my bidding, or thou livest in woe;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Do it, and happy; by my silver bow!

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Awake, and tell thy dream.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Disappears

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Celestial Dian, goddess argentine,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I will obey thee. Helicanus!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Re-enter HELICANUS, LYSIMACHUS, and MARINA

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Sir?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My purpose was for Tarsus, there to strike

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The inhospitable Cleon; but I am

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For other service first: toward Ephesus

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Turn our blown sails; eftsoons I'll tell thee why.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To LYSIMACHUS

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Shall we refresh us, sir, upon your shore,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And give you gold for such provision

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As our intents will need?

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: With all my heart; and, when you come ashore,

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: I have another suit.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: You shall prevail,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Were it to woo my daughter; for it seems

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: You have been noble towards her.

speaker: LYSIMACHUS
text_entry: Sir, lend me your arm.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Come, my Marina.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: SCENE II:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Enter GOWER, before the temple of DIANA at Ephesus

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Now our sands are almost run;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: More a little, and then dumb.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: This, my last boon, give me,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: For such kindness must relieve me,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: That you aptly will suppose

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: What pageantry, what feats, what shows,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: What minstrelsy, and pretty din,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The regent made in Mytilene

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: To greet the king. So he thrived,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: That he is promised to be wived

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: To fair Marina; but in no wise

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Till he had done his sacrifice,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: As Dian bade: whereto being bound,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The interim, pray you, all confound.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: In feather'd briefness sails are fill'd,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And wishes fall out as they're will'd.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: At Ephesus, the temple see,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Our king and all his company.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: That he can hither come so soon,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Is by your fancy's thankful doom.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Exit
